name: Russia–Ukraine War
summary: Ongoing high-intensity interstate war with persistent escalation pathways affecting European security and global commodity markets.

name: Israel–Palestine / Gaza War Spillover
summary: High-casualty conflict theater with regional escalation risk via cross-border fire, proxy activity, and maritime insecurity.

name: Sudan SAF–RSF War
summary: State-fragmenting civil war with severe humanitarian impacts and regional destabilization potential.

name: Myanmar Civil War
summary: Post-coup conflict involving national armed resistance, ethnic armed organizations, and contested state control.

name: DR Congo (Eastern Kivu Complex)
summary: Persistent armed group violence and regional competition in eastern DRC with chronic civilian harm.

name: Central Sahel Insurgency Belt
summary: Multi-state insurgency environment spanning Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger with sustained attacks and governance erosion.

name: Somalia (Al-Shabaab Conflict)
summary: Enduring insurgency threatening state institutions, regional security corridors, and civilian populations.

name: Yemen War and Fragmented Ceasefire
summary: Reduced frontline intensity compared to peak years but fragile ceasefire architecture and maritime spillover risk persist.

name: Syria Multi-Actor Conflict
summary: Fragmented conflict landscape with periodic offensives, foreign force presence, and humanitarian strain.

name: Haiti Gang War / State Collapse Risk
summary: Escalating gang conflict and weak governance threaten national stability and humanitarian access.

name: Ethiopia (Amhara/Tigray Fragility)
summary: Peace implementation gaps and internal military tensions keep relapse and localized escalation risk elevated.

name: South Sudan Political-Military Crisis Risk
summary: Delayed political transition and militia mobilization create renewed civil conflict risk.

name: Nigeria (Northeast Insurgency + Banditry)
summary: Persistent insurgency and diffuse armed violence challenge state capacity and civilian security.

name: Mozambique Cabo Delgado
summary: Insurgency remains degraded but adaptive, threatening local communities and energy infrastructure.

name: Cameroon Anglophone Conflict
summary: Entrenched separatist conflict with recurring violence and limited political breakthrough.

name: India–Pakistan (Kashmir)
summary: Managed but unresolved territorial conflict with high-consequence escalation potential.

name: Taiwan Strait
summary: Military signaling and force posture changes sustain elevated miscalculation and crisis risk.

name: South China Sea Maritime Flashpoint
summary: Competing maritime claims and coercive encounters create recurring confrontation risk.

name: Korean Peninsula
summary: Persistent missile and military signaling cycles maintain high-impact crisis potential.

name: Afghanistan Militancy Spillover Risk
summary: Governance fragility, terrorism risk, and humanitarian pressures sustain regional security concerns.

name: Pakistan (TTP Escalation)
summary: Cross-border militancy and domestic attack campaigns keep security risk elevated.

name: Philippines (Mindanao Insurgent Landscape)
summary: Localized insurgent and extremist activity persists despite peace progress in parts of Mindanao.

name: Southern Thailand Insurgency
summary: Chronic low-intensity violence remains unresolved despite intermittent dialogue.

name: Venezuela–Guyana (Essequibo)
summary: Revived sovereignty dispute with coercive signaling and oil-linked strategic stakes.

name: Colombia (Armed Group Fragmentation)
summary: Fragmented armed groups and criminal economies keep violence cycles active in peripheral zones.

name: Ecuador Internal Security Crisis
summary: Escalating criminal violence and prison-linked armed networks pressure state security institutions.

name: Mexico Organized Violence Hotspots
summary: Persistent cartel competition and state response cycles create sustained lethal violence in multiple corridors.

name: Red Sea Maritime Security
summary: Attacks on shipping and retaliatory actions sustain risk to global trade and regional escalation.

name: Iran–Israel Direct/Proxy Escalation Risk
summary: Direct and proxy confrontation dynamics carry elevated risk of wider regional conflict.

name: Iraq/Syria ISIS Remnant Threat
summary: Residual extremist cells continue low-level attacks amid uneven local governance.

name: Lebanon–Israel Blue Line
summary: Cross-border fire and militia-state tensions sustain a high-volatility frontier.

name: Libya Fragmented Political-Military Standoff
summary: De facto partition and militia competition keep relapse risk active despite reduced nationwide combat.

name: Western Sahara
summary: Protracted sovereignty dispute with intermittent clashes and diplomatic deadlock.

name: Cyprus Green Line
summary: Long-managed partition with low near-term kinetic risk but unresolved status issues.

name: Kosovo–Serbia Tension Corridor
summary: Periodic north Kosovo flare-ups and political friction sustain localized escalation risk.

name: Bosnia and Herzegovina Constitutional Crisis Risk
summary: Entrenched institutional deadlock and separatist rhetoric challenge long-term stability.

name: Armenia–Azerbaijan Post-War Friction
summary: Unsettled border and corridor issues sustain risk of renewed clashes.

name: Georgia (Abkhazia/South Ossetia)
summary: Ceasefire lines remain mostly stable but politically unresolved under competing security frameworks.

name: Moldova (Transnistria)
summary: Longstanding de facto separation with low-level but persistent geopolitical sensitivity.

name: Sahara Transit Arc Instability
summary: Smuggling corridors and armed group mobility create multi-border insecurity.

name: Lake Chad Basin Insurgency
summary: Cross-border militant attacks continue despite ongoing regional military operations.

name: Peru Internal Political-Unrest Risk
summary: Recurring unrest and institutional contention pose episodic stability risks.

name: South Caucasus Transit Corridor Tensions
summary: Competing corridor designs and security guarantees keep diplomatic-military friction elevated.
